oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nicola Marschall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Nicola Marschall was a native Prussian who immigrated to the United States in 1849. He relocated to Alabama in 1851 to earn his living as artist, teacher and portrait painter. Marschall later designed the flag of the Confederacy and the Confederate uniform.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Albert, Joseph, 1825-1886
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Artists
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: VII-A-2v, Item 025; copy print II-J-6 (Photographs), f. 40
